tit.e: Kissaka-toge Pass (a pass located on the border between Maizuru City and Takahama Town)
Kissaka-toge Pass (a pass located on the border between Maizuru City and Takahama Town)

sen.j: 吉坂峠（きっさかとうげ）とは、京都府舞鶴市と福井県大飯郡高浜町の境にある峠。
sen.e: The Kissaka Pass is a pass located on the border between Maizuru City (Kyoto Prefecture) and Takahama Cho, Ooi Gun (Fukui Prefecture).
The Kissaka-toge Pass is a pass located on the border between Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture and Takahama Town, Oi-gun County, Fukui Prefecture.
The Kissaka-toge Pass is a pass located on the border between Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture and Takahama Town, Oi County, Fukui Prefecture.

sen.j: 青葉トンネル（旧称「青葉隊道」）がある。
sen.e: The Aoba Tunnel, formerly known as "Aoba Taido (tunnel)", is built in the Kissaka Pass.
sen.cmt: （隊道＝トンネルですが）用語集の対訳も同じなので、不要で有れば, 「formerly 〜 (tunnel)"」を削除して下さい。
sen.e: The Aoba Tunnel (formerly known as 'Aoba Taido'), is built in the Kissaka-toge Pass.
The Aoba Tunnel (formerly known as 'Aoba Taido'), is built in the Kissaka-toge Pass.
It has an elevation of 86 meters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is at an altitude of 86 meters.
It is at an altitude of 86 meters.

sen.j: 現在は国道27号が走り、舞鶴市や小浜市など北近畿の経済、産業を支える重要幹線道路となっている。
sen.e: Today National Route 27, an arterial road sustaining the economy and the industry of Kita Kinki (Northern Kinki) such as Maizuru City and Obama City, runs through the Kissaka Pass.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Today National Route 27, an arterial road sustaining the economy and the industry of Kita Kinki (Northern Kinki) such as Maizuru City and Obama City, runs through it.
Today National Route 27, an arterial road sustaining the economy and the industry of Kita Kinki (Northern Kinki) such as Maizuru City and Obama City, runs through it.

sen.j: また古より丹後国と若狭国を接する国境の峠として数多の合戦が行われたことでも有名である。
sen.e: The Pass is also famous as a historical battle field for a number of battles, as it was on the border between Tango Province and Wakasa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Pass is also famous as a historical battle field for a number of battles, as it was on the border between Tango Province and Wakasa Province.
The Pass is also famous as a historical battle field for a number of battles, as it was on the border between Tango Province and Wakasa Province.

sen.j: 江戸時代期には小浜藩によって関所が設けられ、要所として知られていた。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it was known as a strategic spot with a sekisho (checking station) built by Obama Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it was known as a strategic spot with a sekisho (checking station) built by Obama clan.
sen.cmt: スペース削除、用語変更しました。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, it was known as a strategic spot with a sekisho (checking station) built by Obama clan.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道小浜線
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company Obama Line
West Japan Railway Company Obama Line
West Japan Railway Company Obama Line
National Route 27
National Route 27
National Route 27

sen.j: 京都府道564号松尾吉坂線
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Road 564, Matsuo-Kissaka Route
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Road 564, Matsuo-Kissaka Line
